Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.notebook

Class Notebook

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.notebook.Notebook
  • public class Notebook
extends java.lang.Object
    The Notebook class stores a list of several task lists, as well as an additional list that has all of the active tasks that are in all of the task lists.
    Author:
    Matthew A Dorsey (madorse2@ncsu.edu)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Notebook

        public Notebook​(java.lang.String name)
        Constructs notebook object.
        Parameters:
        name - name to assign to notebook.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name is null, empty, or has the same name as the active task list.

    • Method Detail

      • getNotebookName

        public java.lang.String getNotebookName()
        returns value of notebook name field
        Returns:
        a note book name

      • isChanged

        public boolean isChanged()
        returns the value of is changed field
        Returns:
        the value of is changed field

      • setNotebookName

        public void setNotebookName​(java.lang.String name)
        sets name of notebook to value passed as a parameter
        Parameters:
        name - name to set notebook name field to

      • setChange

        public void setChange​(boolean change)
        sets the value of the isChanged field
        Parameters:
        change - boolean variable containing isChanged field

      • saveNotebook

        public void saveNotebook​(java.io.File file)
        saves notebook to file specified as a parameter. isChaged field is update to false.
        Parameters:
        file - location to store notebook's information

      • addTaskList

        public void addTaskList​(TaskList taskList)
        adds task list to list of task lists
        Parameters:
        taskList - list of tasks
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name of task list is the same as the active task list, or is a duplicate of a task list that is already in the list of task lists.

      • getTaskListsNames

        public java.lang.String[] getTaskListsNames()
        returns array of strings containing the names of all task lists in the notebook. The active task list is always first
        Returns:
        array of strings containing the names of all task lists

      • setCurrentTaskList

        public void setCurrentTaskList​(java.lang.String taskListName)
        Sets the currentTaskList to the AbstractTaskList with the given name. If a TaskList with that name is not found, then the currentTaskList is set to the activeTaskList.
        Parameters:
        taskListName - string the specifies the task list to set to the current task list

      • getCurrentTaskList

        public AbstractTaskList getCurrentTaskList()
        returns the current task list
        Returns:
        the current task list

      • editTaskList

        public void editTaskList​(java.lang.String taskListName)
        Updates the name of current task list.
        Parameters:
        taskListName - name of the task list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the current task list is the active task list, and if the name of the task list is the same as the abstract task list or is a duplicate of another task list already in the list.

      • removeTaskList

        public void removeTaskList()
        Removes the current task list from the list of task lists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the current task list is the active task list

      • addTask

        public void addTask​(Task t)
        Adds a task to the current task list
        Parameters:
        t - task to add to current task list

      • editTask

        public void editTask​(int idx,
                     java.lang.String taskName,
                     java.lang.String taskDescription,
                     boolean recurring,
                     boolean active)
        Updates the fields of a task in the currentTaskList. If the currentTaskList is the activeTaskList, not action is taken.
        Parameters:
        idx - integer specifying the location of the task whose fields will be updated
        taskName - new task name assigned to task
        taskDescription - new task description to assign to task
        recurring - new task recurring designation to assign to task
        active - new task active designation to assign to task
